thread.title: J.K. Rowling and the '50 Shades of Grey' author both completely own Piers Morgan
thread.title_full: J.K. Rowling and the '50 Shades of Grey' author both completely own Piers Morgan

author: Christina Careaga
title: J.K. Rowling and the '50 Shades of Grey' author both completely own Piers Morgan
text:
Is Piers Morgan a masochist for Twitter burns? Because he's now turning to a BDSM expert.
In the midst of getting completely owned in his ongoing Twitter battle with Harry Potter author and unrivaled Twitter queen J.K. Rowling , Morgan attempted to turn to another famous author for a moment of relief: 50 Shades of Grey mastermind E.L. James .
SEE ALSO: Piers Morgan simply does not realize J.K. Rowling masterfully subtweeted him
Hi @E_L_James , any chance you could start tweeting me one of your books? I need some relief from this Harry Potter crap.
— Piers Morgan (@piersmorgan) February 15, 2017
Unfortunately for Morgan (and fortunately for pretty much everyone else), he walked right into another epic roasting at the hands of a Potter fan.
James responded to the TV personality with an unattributed Quote: .
@piersmorgan 'I believed that the more exposure I got in the press, the better my career would progress. Trouble was, I became overexposed'
— E L James (@E_L_James) February 15, 2017
The tweet standing alone is a pretty good burn on Morgan, obviously insinuating his battle with Rowling is a desperate quest for attention. But who said it?
With the follow-up tweet, James dropped the hammer.
@piersmorgan Gilderoy Lockhart, from Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets.
— E L James (@E_L_James) February 15, 2017
It. Was. From. Harry. Potter.
The Quote: was pulled from a conversation between Lockhart, a famous wizarding celebrity , and Harry Potter in the second book of the series.
Of course, Potter fans loved this perfect interaction.
@E_L_James @piersmorgan E L James just won the Internet for today.
— Shammoz #WithWine™ (@Shammoz) February 16, 2017
@E_L_James pic.twitter.com/G12IcoIIv2
— Jeanna Skinner (@JeannaLStars) February 16, 2017
@E_L_James @piersmorgan You. Are. Amazing!!!
— Fiona P (@mooreridge) February 15, 2017
Who's next in line to ether Morgan? We can't wait to see.
BONUS: J.K. Rowling weighs in hard on the Donald Trump/Meryl Streep feud
